column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14167](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14167.html) ([WIP] docs: improve linux tar packages by c
The file is required and not redundant (see the build failures of gitian and travis)

I suspected that,  but I don't get the underlying reason,  why a .txt file
with unintuitive contents is mandatory. It's confusing for the reader.
If impossible to remove, can we keep the file but have only a link in it?


On Tue, 20 Nov 2018, 22:48 MarcoFalke <notifications@github.com wrote:

> The file is required and not redundant (see the build failures of gitian
> and travis)
>
> â€”
Link to what? See the linked conflicting pull requests for how this is being used.

Link to the official documentation for running a node, to avoid duplication and confusion.  \nHowever, I guess I'm missing something here. Will read up on gitian builds and the related PRs. Thanks for now.
Oh that makes sense I guess. Include the essential information in the distributed (offline) file and link to an online resource for further information.

I updated [the commit](https://github.com/merland/bitcoin/commit/adc0ff217c6a1f1ed7b2b0f2664ccb65dade5093) according to the discussion above. Hopefully ok for gitian build.  
Would you consider re-opening the PR?  

ping @MarcoFalke
GitHub won't allow to reopen a pull request after the linked branch has been force pushed. Feel free to create a fresh pull request.
